body_en: It is noteworthy that the topic and references to the food crisis mostly appear in the headlines after March 9, the date when personal sanctions were [imposed against](https://www.businessinsider.com/oligarch-sanction-russian-billionaire-andrey-melnichenko-eurochem-vacation-ukraine-putin-2022-7) the main beneficiary of fertiliser producer EuroChem, as well as a [ban](https://gro-intelligence.com/insights/russia-enacts-partial-ban-on-grain-exports-in-another-hit-to-global-wheat-supplies) on grain exports from March 15 to June 30.
name: freezing-europe-23-DefaultText
